sense.name: a portable timepiece
sense.examples: The salesclerk showed Sally several styles of women's watches. The man wore a watch on a gold chain clipped to his vest pocket. John replaced the battery in his watch.

sense.name: a fixed period of duty, usually on a ship
sense.examples: We sailed around the clock, each taking a three-hour watch while the others rested. The ship's log recorded no incidents during the second watch of the night. He didn't want such a failure to happen on his watch. (metaphoric extension to a job for which one is responsible)

sense.name: surveillance, close observation
sense.examples: The FBI is keeping a close watch on two suspected terrorists. The government kept a close watch on the man's overseas business transactions. You need to keep a careful watch on the engine temperature because it might overheat.

sense.name: care-taking vigil
sense.examples: The shepherds kept watch over their flocks by night. Who is keeping a watch over the baby while Mary is out?

sense.name: someone doing lookout or surveillance
sense.examples: He worked as a watch for the mob, tracking events from his front room window. The soldiers sent a boy to be the watch, having him climb a tree and hide among the branches. John worked the midnight shift as a watch on the factory grounds.

sense.name: crew or officers of a ship on a duty period
sense.examples: The sailor was a member of the starboard watch on the battleship. The first watch reported sighting enemy ships directly north of the vessel.
